summary: The National Nuclear Security Administration relies on contractors to help maintain a safe, secure, and reliable nuclear stockpile. NNSA requires its contractors to adhere to federal, state, and local regulations. However, NNSA's contractors view some of these requirements as unnecessarily burdensome. NNSA identified 91 requirements its contractors viewed as burdensome, and committed to reviewing 16 of them in a 2019 report. For example, identified requirements...
title: Contractor Oversight: Information on the National Nuclear Security Administration's Report on Burdensome Regulatory Requirements
